content.title: Mukhya Mantri Shahri Ajeevika Guarantee Yojna
content.department: Department of Urban Development, Government of Himachal Pradesh
content.details: The 'Mukhya Mantri Shahri Ajeevika Guarantee Yojna' was launched to enhance livelihood security in urban areas by providing 120 days of guaranteed wage employment to every household in a financial year. The scheme will be implemented in all the Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) and Cantonment Boards (CBs) in Himachal Pradesh.
benefits: Guaranteed 120 days of employment to eligible beneficiaries in urban local bodies
Unemployment allowance of ₹75 per day if employment is not provided within 15 days of registration
Skill training under the Deen Dyal Antodaya-National Urban Livelihood Mission (DAY-NULM)
eligibility: All adult members of the household who register under this scheme
Local resident of the Urban Local Body
Willing to do unskilled work at projects or in Sanitation Services
Upper age limit for providing work is 65 years
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Applicants may visit the Online Portal to register and fill the application form.
documents_required: Front Page of Bank Passbook/India Post Payments Bank
Family members' details and copy of their Aadhaar Card

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to enhance livelihood security in urban areas by providing 120 days of guaranteed wage employment to every household in a financial year.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Urban Development, Government of Himachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: All adult members of the household who are local residents of the Urban Local Body and willing to do unskilled work.

faqs.question: What does 'local resident of the ULB' mean?
faqs.answer: 'Local resident of the ULB' refers to individuals who reside within the jurisdiction of the Urban Local Body.

faqs.question: Can individuals above the age of 65 apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, individuals above the age of 65 are generally not eligible to apply under this scheme.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefits include guaranteed employment, skill training, and bank linkage.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant may apply through Online and Offline mode.
